result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Right Preliminary Hearing & Order to Bind Over filed by Atty Erik McFarland

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:10 PM Defendant John Joseph Mielke in court.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for John Joseph Mielke.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Jambois calls the case and states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

1:14 PM Defendant John Joseph Mielke appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of WI. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of 4th Offense OWI.

Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her reasons on the record.
Court will set a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
